alert.note: Alert for Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Pennington Co Plains; Southern Meade Co Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued February 10 at 2:24AM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...Much warmer than average temperatures are expected today with gusty northwest winds. A few rain showers are also possible from northwestern into south central South Dakota. High temperatures will mainly be in the 50s, with minimum relative humidity ranging from 30 to 40 percent. Northwest winds will gust to around 50 mph over northwestern South Dakota and on the plains to the east of the Black Hills. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Friday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the very high category.

area.areaDesc: Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Pennington Co Plains; Southern Meade Co Plains
